text: The Kentucky Downs Ladies Turf Stakes, raced as the Three Chimneys Ladies Turf Stakes is a Grade III American Thoroughbred horse race for fillies and mares that are three years old or older, over a distance of 1 mile on the turf held annually in September at Kentucky Downs racetrack in Franklin, Kentucky during their short turf meeting. The event currently carries an offered purse of $500,000. ==History== The race was inaugurated in 1992 as the Rachel Jackson Stakes in honor of Rachel Jackson the wife of Andrew Jackson, the 7th President of the United States. Her family moved close to the area where the Kentucky Downs racetrack is located on the border of Kentucky and Tennessee.White House History biography The event was not run for 2 years and when it resumed in 1998 it was run as the Kentucky Cup Ladies Turf Handicap. The event was renamed to its current name Ladies Turf Stakes in 2011. In 2017 the event was upgraded to a Grade III. With the influx of gaming revenue at Kentucky Downs the purse for the event has risen dramatically to nearly $500,000 offered by 2019. ==Records== Speed record: * 1 mile - 1:34.34 – Regal Glory (2020) Margins: * lengths - Secret Someone (2016) ;Most wins by a jockey * 2 - Rafael Bejarano (2003, 2005) * 2 - Pat Day (1999, 2001) * 2 - Mark Guidry (2004, 2011) * 2 - Larry Melancon (1998, 2000) * 2 - Jose L.
